bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 23, 1941

div1.p: Hench will send Kean additional reprints of the Wyeth painting. He comments on the discovery, at the New York Academy of Medicine, of a notebook believed to belong to Lazear. He wonders if Carroll's son sold it to the Academy.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 23, 1941
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
NOV
Sunday 11/23/41
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH
DR. CHARLES H. SLOCUMB
My dear Gen. Kean
div1.p:
I am writing this at home on Sunday “sans
secretary”. I'm glad you liked the Hygeia reprints
you suggest your desire to use some as “Christmas
Greetings from # 7 ” - it would indeed make an
unusual greeting when autographed by you
for your friends. I'm flattered to feel that you
are willing to so use a reprint of mine.
Now I write to urge you to let me send you
50 or 100 more reprints if you wish or
even more. Doubtless you have many relatives
& friends who would be delighted to see
“you in oils”. As I told you thanks to
Wyeth's generousity, I have a large supply of
the reprints & would be more than delighted to
give you all you want. If you don't deserve
all I can do for you in return for all the
wonderful help youve given me I dont know
who does!! And I wouldn't know the
meaning of the word “appreciation”.

I just got Miss Wood's letter about her
discovery of the notebook in the New York
Academy of Medicine. I can't wait to
see it!! It really may be the long lost
AC
K
notebook of Lazear- may it not ? However I
didnt know that Lazear did anything on
electrozone. I've got “ants in my pants”- I'm so
anxious to see it or a copy! I'm writing
Miss Wood and the library at once. Do let me
know if you recognize the handwriting of the
notebook - Reeds, Lazears, Neate's or someone else:
I have originals or photostats of the handwriting
of all the 4 principles so I too will
try to identify it. Do you suppose Carroll(son)
sold the book to the New York Academy? I
must trace its source!
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours Philip S Hench I'm sure Mr Kellogg would send you as
many large copies(certainly unframed, possibly
framed) as you might wish to give away
at Xmas time. As he told me they got them
to give away & from their standpoint it adds
some distinction (removes the element of
“advertising”) when someone else gives them
away. So don't be too modest!
By the way what do you say to
Pinto's belief that you were one of the first
nine who submitted to Lazear's mosquitos!!
Come on now, Confess!!
